subtitles.text: This is Nitrna, I am Aika Kine from C4.
This is the third game project.
Please give me your best regards.
What is the game you are going to challenge this time?
What is it?
It's "Don't laugh, read aloud".
What's that?
I will explain the rules of the "Don't Laugh Aloud" game.
You will take turns reading aloud a story from the textbook.
However, you must read aloud according to the various instruction cards.
You may change the words or add movements.
If either the reader or listener laughs, a chalk tip will be taken.
The person who has the most chalk chips when the story is read aloud will be the winner.
I didn't understand it at first, but now I might understand it a little better.
That's good, that's good, that's good.
I'm a little worried that I'm going to make you laugh a lot.
Really?
Because you haven't even looked at the subject matter.
That's right.
I wonder what they'll come up with.
I don't know if I can handle it.
I laugh at things I'm not supposed to laugh at.
I wonder if I'll be okay... since I've been told absolutely not to laugh.
I'll do my best not to laugh.
Let's play rock-paper-scissors first.
I guess it doesn't have to be like this anymore.
Okay, today we'll read "Red Riding Hood." Let's begin.
Let's start with the music "Don't Laugh, Don't Laugh, Don't Laugh
